meanings.definition: Abnormally low body temperature, often caused by exposure to cold weather.
meanings.sent1: After falling into the icy lake, the hiker experienced hypothermia and needed immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent2: The mountaineer developed hypothermia after getting lost in the snowstorm.
meanings.sent3: The penguin joked that he was experiencing hypothermia after swimming in the chilly ocean for too long.
meanings.sent4: In the freezing winter, the abandoned house seemed to suffer from hypothermia, with its walls feeling cold to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The hypothermia warning on the weather forecast reminded everyone to bundle up in layers before going outside.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the body loses heat faster than it can produce it, leading to dangerously low body temperature.
meanings.sent1: The marathon runner collapsed at the finish line due to severe hypothermia from running in the rain for hours.
meanings.sent2: The elderly man was rushed to the hospital with hypothermia after his heater broke during a winter storm.
meanings.sent3: The snowman laughed and said he had hypothermia from standing outside all day in the cold.
meanings.sent4: The dying campfire struggled to stay lit, showing signs of hypothermia as the wind blew out its feeble flames.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's tale of surviving hypothermia in the Arctic made everyone shiver with fear and admiration.
